channel.title: 1st Gen iPhone
channel.description:
Its horrible I know. My Dad gave it to me since he got the new one.
It's terribly slow, and has horrible re-action time.
So I was wondering if there was a way to speed it up! :). When I play temple run (don't look at me like that) I have to jump/slide/shift early so I don't fall/crash.
Thanks :)

item.title: 1st Gen iPhone
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

I would say, keep the phone if you still have the original box and soon it will become a rare that collectors seek.

Read full topic

item.title: 1st Gen iPhone
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

These sell for about $120-$150 for some reason, more than the 3g’s selling price I believe. Sell it and buy a 3gs haha(second hand).

Read full topic

item.title: 1st Gen iPhone
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

I’d like to have one of those for collecting purposes; I’d never use it, but it’s not really being put into production anymore.
What firmware is it on? If it’s 4.0 or above (which I highly doubt, but just incase), turn off spotlight search in the settings for everything. If that fails, then I’d advise just rebooting it every so often.

Read full topic

item.title: 1st Gen iPhone
item.dc:creator: @DEFET DEFET
item.description:
@DEFET wrote:

I have it too. It cannot view messages well or fast, and it cannot play Fruit Ninja at a speed sufficient enough to get over 200 points.

Read full topic

item.title: 1st Gen iPhone
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:2, topic:428069”][quote author=Wet Dreamss link=topic=530756.msg3876434#msg3876434 date=1325710240]
Its horrible I know. My Dad gave it to me since he got the new one.

It’s terribly slow, and has horrible re-action time.

So I was wondering if there was a way to speed it up! :). When I play temple run (don’t look at me like that) I have to jump/slide/shift early so I don’t fall/crash.

Thanks
[/quote]
I didn’t know The first gen ipod could play games o-o … No troll here
I thought the gaming didn’t come out till the second gen like ios 2.3.# something like that
You can delete some apps but that’s about it and closing all the apps running in the process, the first gen has an incredibly low cpu and ram[/quote]

He said Iphone not ipod lmao

Read full topic
